trans-unit.source: Represents an object type that has a width, height, and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ImageMetadata"></xref> such as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> and a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingImage"></xref>.
This is an abstract class.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ImageSource"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ImageSource"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the height of the image in measure units (96ths of an inch).
The height of the image.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ImageMetadata"></xref> associated with the image.
The metadata associated with the image.
Converts pixels to DIPs in a way that is consistent with MIL.
Width of the bitmap, in dots per inch.
Width of the bitmap, in pixels.
The natural size of the bitmap in MIL Device Independent Pixels (DIPs, or 1/96").
Creates a string representation of this object based on the current culture.
A string representation of this object.
Creates a string representation of this object based on the <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> passed in.
If the provider is `null`, the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture"></xref> is used.
An <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
A string representation of this object.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the width of the image in measure units (96ths of an inch).
The width of the image in measure units (96ths of an inch).
Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.
The format to use.
-or-
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The provider to use to format the value.
-or-
A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
